stem: A 68-year-old male with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia presents to the emergency department with sudden onset right-sided weakness and slurred speech. His NIHSS score is 12. Which of the following interventions is the PRIORITY?

patient.chiefComplaint: Sudden onset right-sided weakness and slurred speech

itemContext.sbar: Patient is a 68-year-old male presenting with acute right-sided weakness and slurred speech, onset approximately 1 hour prior to arrival. NIHSS score is 12. Last known well was this morning. Rule out stroke.

rationale.correct: Initiating the stroke protocol and obtaining a CT scan of the head without contrast is the priority. This is crucial to determine if the patient is experiencing an ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke, which will dictate further treatment.
rationale.incorrect: Consulting physical therapy is important for rehabilitation but is not the priority in the acute setting. Determining the type of stroke and initiating appropriate treatment takes precedence.
clinicalPearls: Time is brain in stroke management. Rapid assessment and intervention are critical.
A CT scan without contrast is the initial imaging modality to differentiate between ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke.
Permissive hypertension is often allowed in acute ischemic stroke to maintain cerebral perfusion.

questionTrap.commonMistake: Prioritizing interventions that may be harmful before diagnosis (e.g., aspirin in hemorrhagic stroke) or delaying critical diagnostic procedures.

mnemonic.name: FAST
mnemonic.description: Face, Arm, Speech, Time - to recognize stroke symptoms quickly.
mnemonic.application: This mnemonic helps with rapid recognition of stroke symptoms, emphasizing the importance of immediate action.
